comments.body: What's the difference between a "locally defined class" and a "local class"?

Yes, "local classes" is Java lingo.

On Fri, May 8, 2015 at 4:43 PM, Dmitry Petrashko notifications@github.com
wrote:

> 
> My guess is:
> 
> class A{
>   class B
>   def foo = {
>     class C
>   }
> }
> 
> Class B is locally defined, class C is local.
> Though the naming here is indeed confusing.
